lines.text: Bolshevist bitch or mather?
I am the mother.
Well then, you'll tell where they
[partisans]
are.
I will tell nothing.
Do you have only one child?
No.
How? Do you have another kids? Sons or daughters?
Sons. They all are sons. There, in the forest... And beyond the forest... Sons.
[Kurt shoots]

[pointing at a number on a woman's neck]
And what's this?
My German surname. Do you want to eat?
No, we don't. We came here not for eating.

[reading out the order about yielding bread to Germans]
"Those, who in 3 days will not fulfil his duty to motherland and German army, will be sentenced to the..."
Muy I ask?
Who's there?
Who are you?
Surname!
412. Muy I ask... Fulfil our duty to which motherland?
Clearly which. Which are you living in? German motherland.

[to her sister, Pusya - lover of German commandant]
Don't you dare mentioning mother! You had not russian mother.
Don't you dare cross yourself!
Eudokim Petrovich, have mercy! For God's sake...
Don't touch God. It's not your God. He doesn't sell himself to Germans.
People went crazy, Mr. Captain!... They dummy up, refuse to utter a word. Just watching.
What does it mean "watching"?
Watching and keeping silence.

[surprised to see her husband - soviet soldier]
Seryozha?
[crying for help]
Kuuurt!
I thought your last word will be "mama".

[fiercely trying to burst through soviet soldier to German captives]
Darling! Give me at least one fascist!
no, it were not our fathers. Let them face the verdict of the people for our sorrow and suffering!
Oh, soul that wants to live good must fight for truth. /from old ukrainian song/
